textResponsePart.text:
The Content Platform, also known as the Content Portal, is a web application available at https://portal.content.lesmills.com/. It is designed for B2B clients, such as clubs and partners, to access and manage Les Mills content. The platform allows users to:

1. Search and browse content
2. Play videos
3. Manage playlists
4. View content metadata
5. Get embed codes for integration
6. Obtain API tokens
7. View usage analytics (future functionality)

The Content Portal provides access to royalty-free video content produced by Les Mills, along with supporting metadata and files. It features curated playlists organized by program, collections, and releases, as well as the ability to create custom playlists.

content.text: ** Access to the Content Portal and API tokens is granted to each Les Mills client individually. You are responsible for managing access permissions for your users within your own solution, website, or web application. The Content Portal does not include a permission management system for users who are not direct Les Mills customers. # **Content Portal** ## **What is Content Portal?** **Content Portal** \- is a web application available on https://portal.content.lesmills.com/ , where clubs and partners can: * Search and Browse content * Play Videos * Manage Playlists * View Content Metadata * Get embed codes for integration * Get API Token * View Usage Analytics (future functionality) **Content Portal** is designed for B2B clients. Streaming URLs and embed codes are intended for integration into clients' distribution platforms, applications, or content management systems to deliver content to their end users. ## **How do playlists work?** LesMills offers two types of playlists: curated playlists (including Collections, Programs, or Releases) and "Your Playlist," where you can create your own. To create a custom playlist in the Content Portal, go to *Menu > Your Playlists > Create*, and fill in the required information. While browsing videos, you can easily add them to your playlist. ## **What is Content API?** **Content API** \- is an application programming interface that provides a set of endpoints for accessing content, metadata, user info, generating streaming URLs and more.

* What is Content API? * Can I query the API from an end-user application? * What is the API rate limit? * Where can I find the API Token? * Where can I find the Directus User ID? * Can I download videos using an API? * Downloads * Can I download videos? * How can I download videos? * Streaming * How does streaming work? * What is a Streaming URL? * How can I use streaming? * How do I get a signed streaming URL? * Does Streaming URL expire after some time? * What video player options are available to use with the Streaming URLs? * What are the standard video specs? * What is an embed code? * How can embed codes be used? # **Content** ## **What content is provided by Content Platform?** Content Platform provides royalty-free video content produced by LesMills as well as supporting metadata and files. ## **How frequent are content updates?** LesMills Content is released on a quarterly basis, making up to 4 signature releases available at all times. ## **What happens to my Collections or Programs playlists during quarterly content updates?** Collections and Programs playlists automatically update when new videos are added or old ones are removed, with no manual intervention needed. There's no need to re-embed web codes or modify your API integration---content updates will display for end users upon a page refresh. ## **How do quarterly updates affect my Releases playlists?

The Content Portal features curated playlists by program, collections and releases while also offering custom built playlists with any combination of videos in the Platform. Was this article helpful? textResponsePart.text: The Content Platform also includes a Content API, which is an application programming interface that provides endpoints for accessing content, metadata, user information, and generating streaming URLs. This allows for integration of Les Mills content into clients' distribution platforms, applications, or content management systems to deliver content to their end users.

output.text:
The Content Platform, also known as the Content Portal, is a web application available at https://portal.content.lesmills.com/. It is designed for B2B clients, such as clubs and partners, to access and manage Les Mills content. The platform allows users to:

1. Search and browse content
2. Play videos
3. Manage playlists
4. View content metadata
5. Get embed codes for integration
6. Obtain API tokens
7. View usage analytics (future functionality)

The Content Portal provides access to royalty-free video content produced by Les Mills, along with supporting metadata and files. It features curated playlists organized by program, collections, and releases, as well as the ability to create custom playlists. The Content Platform also includes a Content API, which is an application programming interface that provides endpoints for accessing content, metadata, user information, and generating streaming URLs. This allows for integration of Les Mills content into clients' distribution platforms, applications, or content management systems to deliver content to their end users.
